quotes.quote: Gold medals aren't really made of gold. They're made of sweat, determination, and a hard-to-find alloy called guts.
Nobody who ever gave his best regretted it.
Whoever said, 'It's not whether you win or lose that counts,' probably lost.
It is not the size of a man but the size of his heart that matters.
The man who complains about the way the ball bounces is likely the one who dropped it.
One man can be a crucial ingredient on a team, but one man cannot make a team.
Always make a total effort, even when the odds are against you.
If you ever dream of beating me, you better wake up and apologize.
Good, better, best. Never let it rest. Until your good is better and your better is best.
The more you sweat in practice, the less you bleed in battle.
Don't give up at half-time. Concentrate on winning the second half.
If you train hard, you'll not only be hard, you'll be hard to beat.
If you don't practice, you don't deserve to win.
Do you know what my favorite part of the game is? The opportunity to play.
The time when there is no one there to feel sorry for you or to cheer for you is when a player is made.
People who work together will win, whether it be against complex football defenses, or the problems of modern society.
One man practicing sportsmanship is far better than 50 preaching it.
It's not whether you get knocked down; it's whether you get up.
If you fail to prepare, you're prepared to fail.
Champions aren't made in gyms. Champions are made from something they have deep inside them. A desire, a dream, a vision.
You might not be able to outthink, outmarket or outspend your competition, but you can outwork them.
If you aren't going all the way, why go at all?
I am building a fire, and everyday I train, I add more fuel. At just the right moment, I light the match.
An athlete cannot run with money in his pockets. He must run with hope in his heart and dreams in his head.
If you have everything under control, you're not moving fast enough.
Talent wins games, but teamwork and intelligence wins championships.
To be a champ you have to believe in yourself when no one else will.
Run when you can, walk if you have to, crawl if you must; just never give up.
A trophy carries dust. Memories last forever.
If you can believe it, the mind can achieve it.
The only way to prove that you're a good sport is to lose.
You miss 100% of the shots you don't take.
Champions keep playing until they get it right.
The game ain't over 'til it's over.
My mind is my biggest asset. I expect to win every tournament I play.
There may be people that have more talent than you, but theres no excuse for anyone to work harder than you do.
Wisdom is always an overmatch for strength.
You can't put a limit on anything. The more you dream, the farther you get.
Sports serve society by providing vivid examples of excellence.
Exercise is king. Nutrition is queen. Put them together and you've got a kingdom.

I've missed more than 9,000 shots in my career. I've lost almost 300 games; 26 times, I've been trusted to take the game winning shot and missed. I've failed over and over and over again in my life. And that is why I succeed.
If you can't outplay them, outwork them.
Toughness is in the soul and spirit, not in muscles.
Never let your head hang down. Never give up and sit down and grieve. Find another way.
The harder the battle, the sweeter the victory.
I hated every minute of training, but I said, â€˜Don't quit. Suffer now and live the rest of your life as a champion.
Some people want it to happen, some wish it would happen, others make it happen.
Sports do not build character. They reveal it.
Play like you're in first, train like you're in second.
The five S's of sports training are: stamina, speed, strength, skill, and spirit; but the greatest of these is spirit.
